website_summaries.verdict: The Altra Provision 3.5 received mostly positive reviews from consumers. They liked this road shoe’s supportive platform, its high-quality build, and its fresh color schemes. Moreover, some of them felt that it was lighter than the previous iteration. Conversely, several complaints arose regarding the bleeding tint of the interior sleeve and the unwieldy medial support system.
pros: Some testers noted that the Altra Provision 3.5 felt lighter than its predecessor, the Provision 3.0
The stability mechanisms of this running shoe were lauded for being able to suitable correct overpronation
The general quality of this shoe’s materials was lauded by consumers
Several runners liked the color schemes and the sporty design
A natural toe splay was appreciated due to the presence of a roomy toe box
cons: The colors of the inner sleeve tended to bleed out, according to several consumers
They noted some discoloration to their socks whenever they took the shoe off
A few testers disliked the medial stability unit because it could apparently be felt under the forefoot

customer_reviews.title: Shoes I received were clearly used.
customer_reviews.text: I am a high school cross country coach and love Altra’s. The shoes themselves are comfortable although they seem slightly smaller than any of my other roughly half dozen pair of Altras I’ve owned, but are still within the realm of acceptable. My biggest complaints are to the seller who clearly sent me a pair that someone else had worn and returned as there were pebbles all through the treads, the laces were already tied up and there was no paper or cardboard inserts in the toes. Perhaps I’m unreasonble, but for $120 I expect shoes that are brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally Pain Free!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a soldier for 16 years and have dealt with serious pain from stress fractures to lower back pain-all from running. After talking to a friend about it he recommended these shoes due to their zero drop and guard rail technologies. All I can say is that I am amazed and am a customer for life. I ran 3 miles today without an ounce of pain, and I haven't done that in years. I am an over-pronator and these shoes make my foot strike feel solid and comfortable. Thanks Altra, you've made running painless and enjoyable again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in quality of shoe
customer_reviews.text: At first was very excited about the shoes. This would have been my fourth pair of shoes from Altra. Started off with the provision 2.5 and moved up to 2 pair of the 3.0. Very happy with the 3.0 When talking or running in the 3.5 it rubs the tops of my toes. This is causing me to get blisters on the tops of my feet. None of my previous shoes came close to doing this. Returning them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect comfort, but flawed
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Altra for a few years now. My feet are highly sensitive but Altra works very well. My only complaint is the overall quality of these shoes, as well as other Altra models I've worn. The bottom of the shoes typically wear out far quicker than any shoes I've worn in the past. Regardless, due to sensitivity of my feet, I continue to purchase Altra but hope the quality someday improves.
customer_reviews.author: M J

customer_reviews.title: I'm and Altra fan, but these are going back.
customer_reviews.text: Regrettably, I'm sending these back. Rubbed a blister on the top of my foot due to the seam where the laces box meets the toe box upper. I love Altra and have been a loyal customer for years, but these are going back. Wish they'd stick with one Provision design.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Vance

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoes Ever
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these shoes as a birthday gift for my son in his second phase of basic training (US Army), now that he's permitted to have regular running shoes. He's worn Brooks for years, but saw these online, and said they're "the best shoes ever" and better than any other running shoe. They run for miles in training and he said the first time out with these shoes was the first time he ran pain-free in months! And he shaved maybe a minute off his time.
customer_reviews.author: Archie Lib

customer_reviews.title: Great fit but questionable quality; peice of the rubber from the sole chipped off.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the feel of these shoes but the quality is questionable. A peice of the sole came off shortly after the first few weeks. It's hardly visible but does have an impact on traction on wet surfaces. I probably won't buy these online again.
customer_reviews.author: loyalhearted

customer_reviews.title: As usual - expectation are met with Altra
customer_reviews.text: I have an extremely hard time finding shoes that fit me. Altra is one of the shoes that makes size 12.5 that actually fit me perfectly when a 12 is too tight and a 13 is way too loose. I love the zero-drop (minimalist) style with extra padding, but not overdone like Hoka or similar shoes. I am a returning Altra buyer so take this review for what its worth. YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: Chester

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite shoe! I have 3 pairs at home and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite shoe! I have 3 pairs at home and one at work. The support is great for being on my feet all day at work, as well as for taking short to medium runs. I wear them the most for CrossFit, although Altra recently came out with a model specifically for the sport. They hold up well and fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great, comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great, comfortable shoe. Purchased because the shoe box is very roomy. Shoe is comfortable. Very popular with the local triathletes. Only downside is that I am a heal striker and the shoe wears down pretty quickly. Popular styles appear to go fast.
customer_reviews.author: Edmond J Fennell

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 pair of Altra Provision 2.5 and absolutely loved them. Both pair help me train and complete for 2 Half Marathons. While I have only had the Provision 3.5 for a couple of weeks, It retains the comfort of the 2.5. I had transitioned to a zero drop shoe years ago and switched to the higher level of cushioning of the Altra. I have a narrow foot, but the Altra's fit well with the very welcome additional space in the toe box. It may feel odd at first, but it will ultimately make it difficult to switch to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great zero drop running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand and this line of running shoe. If you're looking for zero drop, minimalist shoes but also want some even padding, these are the shoes for you. They're like walking on zero drop clouds! I have wide feet with low arches. These shoes have a large toe box.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pange

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad as he was looking for a pair of walking shoes and had set his eyes on this one. He's enjoying the experience so far. His feedback was that sizing ran a bit small length-wise, but perhaps its a matter of breaking into the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: cocom0o

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the looks and fit of these shoes. The roomy toe box is different, but I like it! Side note on sizing: I wear a 10.5 in Brooks running shoes, and the 10.5 in Altra is perfect. Would buy these again from the same seller.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The product is narrower than advertised. It also has a tendency to fall apart. The tread keeps separating after only a couple of weeks and the uppers develop holes where the sides of my toes touch after about a month. Definitely not worth the money. I bought a pair of sneakers at Walmart for ten dollars that fit better and last about 5 times as long
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for pronator
customer_reviews.text: 220 miles. Holding up well for a pronator. Wear is as expected on tread, the upper still looks really good. The shoes are a bit firm but I like the zero drop and they are like my lone peaks but with better fit
customer_reviews.author: John Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe, no issues
customer_reviews.text: Fit a little more snug in the toes than previous versions, but once broken in a fantastic running shoe. Superior to earlier iterations. However, there is a lot of friction in the lacing eyelets, which is both good and bad.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoe around!
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was for my 13 year old son who was always wearing my Altra's (eek) and finally he reached an adult size so I could get him his own pair. He loves them! Now it looks like they have designed a kid line of Altra's.
customer_reviews.author: JBrowning

customer_reviews.title: Great for running if you have wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes as always, I have the paradigms, lone peaks and they have a similar fit. These are a little tighter around the center of my foot, toe box is the same
customer_reviews.author: Tony Gonzales III

customer_reviews.title: Good room for some foot styles, but not mine.
customer_reviews.text: The color wasn’t quite right for what I needed, and because my second toe is longer than my great toe the toe box is not what I need. Too much room and heavier than necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes these a lot! He wears them to work all day as a physical therapist and he says they're comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: holes right where the toe is
customer_reviews.text: after about 5 months the place where the toe is, started tearing apart and now the little toe is completely outside. I can't grasp how a shoe that costs so much and should be rouge is so badly constructed.
customer_reviews.author: shopper like you

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Consistent sizing to other Altras I’ve owned, Love this brand,
customer_reviews.author: Abby Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of running shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit! Great arch support and very comfortable. Worth every penny! I've had 3 pairs of Astras in the past and this is by far the best pair yet. The design improvement is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get from fleet feet or similar store instead
customer_reviews.text: Amazing shoe and design. But this shoe had some manufacturer defects and the tread started to peel away week 1. My two other pairs had well over 500 miles on them. This was my 3rd pair. I contacted Amazon and the company who sold it no resolve go-to a shoe store if you expect customer service
customer_reviews.author: RCG

customer_reviews.title: Please improve durability
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable broken in fit. Support for arches is 👍🏼. However the bottom rubber began falling apart within 6 weeks of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Love Altra running shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Altra shoes. Love to large toe box. Shoe was delivered exactly as expected. This is the first time I ordered shoes on line. Very pleased with the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond J. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe out there
customer_reviews.text: Altras are my favorite running shoe. Finding a wide shoe for my feet was a challenge, but altras are the solution. Very comfortable. I hate wearing any other footwear now!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Wide in the front.
customer_reviews.text: fit as expected, wide in the front. I don't want a change brand any more
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: Turns the dreadmill into a “not so” mill
customer_reviews.text: Best for treadmill because of 0 heel drop. Takes the pressure off of the knees.
customer_reviews.author: thomas west

customer_reviews.title: Shoe is good for supinators.
customer_reviews.text: OK shoes for feet with very high arch's and hammer toes. Excellent seller.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky P

customer_reviews.title: Fits and works as expected
customer_reviews.text: So far this shoe is exactly the quality I've come to expect for Altra.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Found Provision!
customer_reviews.text: Came through with hard to find Altra shoe, very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: victor Giardina

customer_reviews.title: Squeakers
customer_reviews.text: Worst quality shoes I've got from Altra. 5 months in and they are coming apart. 2 months in they started squeaking. The first gens were fine and lasted me 2 years. I don't know why they downgraded quality.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

product_meta.title: ALTRA Men's Provision 3.5 Stabilitätsschuh Herren - Blau, Weiß Running Stability Shoe
product_meta.description: Altra Provision 3.5 Running Shoes With innovative technologies, the Altra Provision 3.5 Running Shoes will provide you with a comfortable and supported ride no matter what the distance. Mesh Upper The Provision 3.5 has a durable mesh upper, a revamp from previous editions. Despite being tough and durable, it is also lightweight and breathable, allowing a steady airflow in and out to keep the feet feeling fresh and cool despite the feet working hard on long runs. Thicker material covers the toes and the heel walls, offering both support and protection to these particularly vulnerable areas. Altra's Footshape toes box means that the feet can spread out naturally, whilst keeping the big to in a straight position for more comfort, speed and stability. Up the foot laces and a padded tongue mean that you can easily find the perfect and comfortable fit.
feature_bullets: Durable Mesh - Tough yet lightweight and breathable.
Heel and Toe Protection - Support and protection offered to the heel and toe with thicker material.
Footshape Toes Box - Toes can spread out naturally which provides greater comfort, speed and stability.
Comfortable Fit - Up the foot laces and a padded tongue.
A-Bound Midsole - Reactive midsole material absorbs shocks, cushions the feet and provides effective rebound.
